title: As long as the lemon trees grow
author: Zoulfa Katouh
description: A powerful and heartbreaking story of love, loss, and the resilience of the human spirit, set against the backdrop of the Syrian civil war.

reviews.review_text: An emotional rollercoaster that beautifully captures the struggles of war and the strength of love.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: A fascinating exploration of life, death, and all the choices that could have been made, as a woman finds herself in a library that lets her explore alternate lives.

reviews.review_text: A thought-provoking and engaging novel about second chances and the lives we live in our minds.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: A captivating tale of a reclusive Hollywood icon who recounts her glamorous and scandalous life story to a young journalist.

reviews.review_text: An enthralling read that beautifully captures the complexities of love, fame, and identity.

title: Tomorrow, and Tomorrow, and Tomorrow
author: Gabrielle Zevin
description: A story about friendship, creativity, and video game design, following two friends over decades as they build worlds together and navigate love, loss, and fame.

reviews.review_text: A beautifully written and immersive journey through time, creativity, and human connection.

title: Pachinko
author: Min Jin Lee
description: A sweeping saga of a Korean family across four generations, enduring hardship and discrimination in 20th-century Japan.

reviews.review_text: An epic and deeply human story that spans generations with elegance and emotional depth.
